posts.message:
“May we stand in this world, not as people in hiding, but as those who help prepare the way of the only-begotten Son of God”.
Alfred Delp, SJ
How do we prepare the way? With every act of love, generosity, and self-giving kindness; by reaching out, binding up the wounded, and making sacrifices for the sake of others.

The certainty of Christian hope lies beyond passion and beyond knowledge.  Therefore we must sometimes expect our hope to come in conflict with darkness, desperation and ignorance.  Therefore, too, we must remember that Christian optimism is not a perpetual sense of euphoria, an indefectible comfort in whose presence neither anguish nor tragedy can possibly exist.  We must not strive to maintain a climate of optimism by the mere suppression of tragic realities.  Christian optimism lies in a hope of victory that transcends all tragedy: a victory in which we pass beyond tragedy to glory with Christ crucified and risen.
- Thomas Merton
Lectio through Luke: An Advent Countdown - Day 11

Worship is an important way to spiritually ‘recharge’, especially amidst what we are collectively experiencing right now.
If you are unable to worship with us, please now you are uphold in prayer.
